Texts.Chs: <一本你认为是自己写的书，但你却不记得曾经写过什么。有一半的单词看起来是那么的不熟悉，而且考虑到你目前的状况，它的不黏糊糊显得很奇怪>
Texts.Eng: <A book full of writing you recognize as your own, yet you have no recollection of ever writing. Half of the words look unfamiliar, and it's oddly un-slimey, given the rest of your current surroundings>.

Texts.Chs: <它描述了一种你不熟悉的生活，写满了一些你永远无法回忆起是否参与其中的使你不熟悉的故事。但毫无疑问，写作中的词形变化和遣词造句是有意义的。但你怎么能写一些东西却不记得呢？>
Texts.Eng: <It describes an unfamiliar life, full of unfamiliar exploits you cannot ever recall participating in. But there is no doubting the inflection and word-choice where the writing makes sense. How could you write something, but not remember it?>
